author: VNExplorer
title: Venezuela military drills start as UK warship sent
text:
The Venezuelan army march during a military parade to celebrate independence day in Caracas in July 2023
Venezuela has ordered the armed forces to hold military exercises in response to the UKâ€™s decision to send a warship to support neighbouring Guyana.
Military leaders said 5,600 soldiers would take part in â€œdefensiveâ€ exercises on Venezuelaâ€™s eastern Caribbean and Atlantic coasts.
Earlier this month, Venezuelan voters backed the creation of a new state in oil-rich Essequibo.
Guyana has administered the area for decades.
In a television address on Thursday, President Nicolas Maduro said the exercises were being launched â€œin response to the provocation and threat of the United Kingdom against peace and the sovereignty of our countryâ€.
He added that the move was â€œpractically a military threat from Londonâ€ and broke the â€œspiritâ€ of a recent agreement reached between Venezuela and Guyana not to use force to settle their dispute.
Guyanese Vice-President Bharrat Jagdeo said the shipâ€™s presence was â€œroutineâ€ and part of building a â€œdefensive capabilityâ€.
â€œWe donâ€™t plan on invading Venezuela. President Maduro knows this and he need not have any worry about that,â€ he said in quotes cited by AFP news agency.
On Sunday, the UK confirmed HMS Trent would take part in joint exercises with Guyana after Christmas.
It had been deployed to the Caribbean to search for drug smugglers, but was re-tasked after Venezuelaâ€™s government threatened to annex the Essequibo region of Guyana.
Venezuela has long claimed ownership of Essequibo, a 61,000 sq-mile region which comprises about two-thirds of Guyana.
It disputes the border which was established under an international agreement in 1899.
Guyana, and British Guiana before it, have administered Essequibo for more than a century.

author: tul
title: #38 HizbulÃ¡ dispara misiles antiaÃ©reos contra cazas israelÃ­es que rompieron la barrera del sonido
text:

[#11](c11#c-11) Y a mi que me da que estÃ¡n buscando quÃ© y dÃ³nde tienen los radares + las frecuencias que usan por si hay alguna variante con lo que tenÃ­an de HizbolÃ¡

[#1](c1#c-1) Es mucho mÃ¡s. Si un misil tira uno de esos aviones se van a vengar matando a 1000 ciudadanos inoventes de la zona, nosequÃ© del taliÃ³n y el daÃ±o deduplicado lo llaman los pedazo de hijos de puta.

Cuando los sobrevivientes a todo esto, se ultra-radicalicen y eduquen a sus hijos desde el radicalismo, y estos crezcan, ya veras la que se va a armar. Luego Israel llorara porque no se que bebes degollados...
[#23](c23#c-23) Oh, quÃ© mono y tierno, cuÃ©ntanos, Â¿QuÃ© tal se siente la ilusiÃ³n de creer vivir en un mundo donde hay justicia? Â¿Reconfortante?

[#17](c17#c-17) O estoy yo muy desfasado o IrÃ¡n tenÃ­a un programa de desarrollo de armamento nuclear, no armamento nuclear.
Por otra parte, con USA detrÃ¡s, IrÃ¡n y Siria son como dos chistes malos para Israel. Los allanan en dos dÃ­as los americanos.
Hace mucho de eso pero en la guerra IrÃ¡n-Irak no estaban a muy distintos niveles e Irak la arrasaron en dos dÃ­as. Siria porque les echo una mano Putin que si no se la cepillan usando al ISIS (armado por occidente) y poco mÃ¡s.
Cuidado, que la noticia es que cazas israelÃ­es violaron el espacio libanÃ©s, y LÃ­bano respondiÃ³ con misiles... pero lo que cualquiera entenderÃ­a como una defensa legÃ­tima de su espacio aÃ©reo ante una incursiÃ³n enemiga con nada menos que cazas de combate, como el bueno indudablemente es Israel mejor lo titulamos como que "HizbulÃ¡ dispara misiles contra cazas israelÃ­es". Y luego por aquello de blanquear y relativizarlo todo un poco mÃ¡s, que es lo que toca cuando los buenos inician el ataque, dentro de la noticia hace referencias al ataque en un marco de "escalada entre las partes" y dice que estÃ¡n "enzarzados en intensos enfrentamientos".
Como decÃ­a CaÃ±ita Brava.... borchenoso.
[#20](c20#c-20) Alguien me explicarÃ¡ algÃºn dÃ­a porque merece tantos millones invertidos Israel.
Lo digo porque aunque en EEUU haya mucho judÃ­o acaudalado sionista que sea partidario de esta mierda, la cantidad de millones que debe costar no sÃ³lo el armamento sino toda la maquinaria propagandÃ­stica debe ser desorbitante. Enjuagar a tanto periodista a nivel mundial no debe ser barato.
Y sÃ­, los judÃ­os serÃ¡n muy acaudalados, pero todo tiene sus lÃ­mites y cuando a un millonario le pides que se rasque el bolsillo mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de las migajas le suele escocer y se le cura el activismo sionista, nacionalista o lo que sea en un pis pas. Por eso son millonarios, claro.
La posiciÃ³n estratÃ©gica de las tierras Palestinas puede justificar parte de todo lo que mete USA allÃ­, pero nunca he entendido por quÃ© tanto.
[#33](c33#c-33) son la cabeza de playa de los gringos en oriente medio, su mision alli es desestabilizar la region
[#33](c33#c-33) La industria armamentÃ­stica hace rica a mucha gente. Y para vender armas, necesitas guerras. Israel es el principal generador de inestabilidad en Oriente Medio.
Inestabilidad y agresiÃ³n = guerra = comercio armamentÃ­stico = dinero (para unos, muerte para otros)
[#40](c40#c-40) No es mala teorÃ­a. Aunque si sÃ³lo le viene bien a la industria armamentÃ­stica alguien deberÃ­a oponerse, pero sin duda mueven tantos millones que deben tener sus tentÃ¡culos muy metidos dentro de muchos culos.
[#20](c20#c-20) Si Israel no reconoce los organismos supranacionales, ni cumplle acuerdos, ni obecede a ninguna jurisdicciÃ³n, ni nada de nada... Â¿por quÃ© habrÃ­a de respetar ningÃºn espacio aÃ©reo o absolutamente nada?
[#36](c36#c-36) Totalmente de acuerdo. Mi crÃ­tica va a los medios y su manipulaciÃ³n del lenguaje para tergiversar la realidad. Unas veces mÃ¡s burda y otras, como Ã©sta, mÃ¡s sutil. Un simple cambio en el orden en que se cuentan los acontecimientos en el titular, y de repente los agresores parecen los agredidos y viceversa.
[#6](c6#c-6) Lo cierto es que esto es peccata minuta comparado con lo de Gaza. Yo si tengo que elegir, elijo que me aterroricen antes que me masacren con bombas, hambre, sed, frÃ­o, etc.
Suma, pero poco. Da mÃ¡s miedo el hecho de que esto tiene visos de ir a mÃ¡s y acabar en guerra. El LÃ­bano deberÃ­a ir agarrÃ¡ndose los machos.

author: editorial@pulzo.com (Editorial Pulzo)
title: AlegrÃ­a para dueÃ±os de carros elÃ©ctricos por nuevos cargadores en BogotÃ¡; serÃ¡n gratuitos
text: Con una inversiÃ³n que supera los 6.000 millones de pesos, la SecretarÃ­a Distrital de Movilidad, La Rolita y Enel Colombia (a travÃ©s de su lÃ­nea Enel X) presentaron este 28 de diciembre la primera red de cargadores pÃºblicos para [vehÃ­culos elÃ©ctricos](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/vehiculos-electricos), que estarÃ¡ compuesta por 15 electrolineras distribuidas en seis zonas. (Lea tambiÃ©n: [Carros avaluados en menos de $ 54 millones pagarÃ¡n esta cifra (alta) en impuesto vehicular](https://www.pulzo.com/economia/impuesto-vehicular-colombia-2024-carros-pagaran-4-millones-por-precio-PP3348457)) El primer punto que se pone en servicio estÃ¡ ubicado en el barrio La Alhambra, en el parqueadero de la calle 114 A nÃºmero 45-98, donde se tienen disponibles tres terminales de carga rÃ¡pida, con conectores CCS1, CCS2 y GBT, que tienen la capacidad de cargar una baterÃ­a de 60 a 100 KW promedio en hora y media, llevÃ¡ndola de 0 a 100 %. ğŸš€ğŸ’¡ El lanzamiento de nuestras estaciones de carga es un paso activo hacia la promociÃ³n de la movilidad sostenible en BogotÃ¡. ğŸŒ¿ğŸš— [#ConectaConLaRolita] [pic.twitter.com/eyKAUIgce9] â€” Movilidad BogotÃ¡ (@SectorMovilidad) [December 28, 2023] El servicio serÃ¡ gratuito durante los primeros 15 dÃ­as y los usuarios tendrÃ¡n una hora gratis de parqueo presentando el tiquete sellado al salir del estacionamiento, explicÃ³ la gerente de la Operadora Distrital de Transporte La Rolita, Carolina MartÃ­nez. Puntos de carga pÃºblicos en BogotÃ¡ para carros elÃ©ctricos Los otros puntos de carga, construidos en la carrera 10 nÃºmero 97-63, Modelia (calle 23f con carrera 75) y NicolÃ¡s de FedermÃ¡n (calle 58Âª Bis con kr.38), tambiÃ©n estÃ¡n ubicados dentro de [parqueaderos](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/parqueaderos) del Distrito y entrarÃ¡n en funcionamiento durante las prÃ³ximas semanas. De acuerdo con la secretaria de Movilidad, Deyanira Ãvila, quedan en construcciÃ³n otros dos puntos en la Terminal de Transportes del Salitre, ubicada en la calle 22c N.68 f-34 y en San Andresito de la calle 9 con carrera 37a, los cuales serÃ¡n entregados en el primer semestre de 2024. [InsÃ³lito precio de los carros usados en Venezuela; cuestan mÃ¡s que en Colombia](/carros/carros-usados-venezuela-cuestan-que-colombia-aveo-es-carisimo-PP3347909) [AtenciÃ³n, conductores: Gobierno fijÃ³ valores del impuesto vehicular para 2024](/economia/impuesto-carro-2024-colombia-gobierno-ajusto-precios-PP3346558A) [CuÃ¡nto vale una patineta elÃ©ctrica en Colombia y caracterÃ­sticas a tener en cuenta](/economia/cuanto-vale-patineta-electrica-colombia-mas-barata-cuesta--21 -PP3346000A) [Â¿Se puede viajar en carro elÃ©ctrico en Colombia? Conozca lo que necesita para hacerlo](/carros/carros-electricos-colombia-sirven-para-viajar-colombia-cuantos-kilometros-PP3346082) Para la definiciÃ³n de los puntos, la [SecretarÃ­a de Movilidad](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/secretaria-de-movilidad) participÃ³ con el Gobierno Nacional en un proyecto de cooperaciÃ³n tÃ©cnica con GIZ-CooperaciÃ³n Alemana Colombia para analizar las zonas con mayor potencial de demanda, teniendo en cuenta las matrices de generaciÃ³n de viajes origen y destino. AsÃ­ mismo, se identificaron los puntos donde no habÃ­a estaciones de carga elÃ©ctrica y se priorizaron teniendo en cuenta los bienes de propiedad del Distrito que estuvieran disponibles, dijo Ãvila. Buenas noticias: [@SectorMovilidad], [@LaRolitaBog]y [@EnelColombia]nos hemos unido para implementar la primera red de cargadores pÃºblicos para carros elÃ©ctricos, un paso fundamental para avanzar hacia una movilidad mÃ¡s sostenible, descarbonizada y amigable con el medio ambiente. [pic.twitter.com/HHGzM72JVx] â€” Deyanira Avila (@Deyaniravilam) [December 28, 2023] Se estima que en la capital de paÃ­s hay 6.822 vehÃ­culos elÃ©ctricos, segÃºn el Registro Distrital Automotor de [BogotÃ¡](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/bogota), entre automÃ³viles, camionetas, motocicletas, camiones, buses, entre otros, que a partir de ahora contarÃ¡n con una red de recarga pÃºblica de fÃ¡cil acceso en toda la ciudad. LO ÃšLTIMO [Carros] Hace 1 hora [AlegrÃ­a para dueÃ±os de carros elÃ©ctricos por nuevos cargadores en BogotÃ¡; serÃ¡n gratuitos](/carros/carros-electricos-e-hibridos-bogota-tienen-nuevos-cargadores-publicos-gratis-PP3348947) [Carros] Hace 6 horas [InsÃ³lito precio de los carros usados en Venezuela; cuestan mÃ¡s que en Colombia](/carros/carros-usados-venezuela-cuestan-que-colombia-aveo-es-carisimo-PP3347909) [Carros]

author: Times Of India
title: Flamingos Nesting: Lesser flamingos nesting in urban area | Ahmedabad News - Times of India
text: AHMEDABAD: Flamingos within city limits are an incredible sight. What is more exciting is that for the first time, ornithologists have documented lesser flamingos nesting in an urban setting. â€˜Nesting attempt of Lesser Flamingos (Phoeniconaias Minor) in urban areas of Bhavnagar, Gujaratâ€™ by Kandarp Andharia and Prashant Andharia details the first-ever recorded instance of 70 to 90 birds actively nesting behind the Bhavnagar airport in a 1.5sq km lake formed by excess water from a nearby salt pan despite the traffic, construction, congestion and other disturbances in Oct 2021. The researchers observed that a few birds were sitting on mound-like structures, while others were digging out the soft mud and putting it on mounds. At least eight birds were giving the mud deposition a round shape with their beaks. What makes the find one of its kind is that this location is more than 300km from the birdsâ€™ traditional nesting ground in the Little Rann of Kutchâ€™s eastern regions. A failed attempt away from LKR was recorded in Porbandar in 1994. Ornithologists noticed nests in 2022, 2023 were destroyed by stray dogs. The birds have returned again this year and are being closely monitored by the duo.We also published the following articles recently Bird enthusiasts thrilled as they record 56 bird species in ArippaDiscover the diverse bird species spotted by Warblers and Waders during their 32nd annual trail at Arippa Eco Tourism Centre. Rare sightings like the White Bellied Woodpecker were observed. Join this group to learn about environmental changes and appreciate nature's beauty.111463258 These oldest inhabited termite mounds have been active for 34,000 yearsDiscover the oldest active termite mounds in South Africa, over 30,000 years old. Researchers found these ancient structures near the Buffels River in Namaqualand, shedding light on prehistoric climates and the environmental benefits of termite colonies. Learn more about their role in offsetting climate change and sustaining ecosystems.111477256 Bird flu restricts McDonald's breakfast hours in Australia: What we know so farLearn about McDonald's breakfast service changes in Australia due to egg supply shortage from avian influenza outbreaks. Authorities assure successful containment of the virus with minimal impact on egg-laying hens. Retailers implement limits on egg purchases to handle supply disruptions.111427684

author: Kelly Keller
title: Peyton Stearns grueling day in Dubai ends in collapse
text:
Peyton Stearns, a 23-year-old American tennis player currently ranked WTA No. 46, experienced a severe physical setback at the Dubai Tennis Championships after being compelled to play multiple matches in a single day due to scheduling disruptions.
The tournament, affected by rain delays, required Stearns to compete in two singles matches with minimal rest between them. She began her day with a hard-fought victory over seventh seed Zheng Qinwen, a match lasting over two and a half hours. Shortly after, Stearns faced 17-year-old Mirra Andreeva and, visibly fatigued, suffered a swift defeat. The physical toll culminated in Stearns collapsing in the corridor post-match, needing medical attention. She later revealed that she had been battling a gastrointestinal illness, which, combined with the demanding schedule, led to her withdrawal from a scheduled doubles match. Despite this incident, Stearnsâ€™ performance in Dubai, including her first career Top 10 win against Zheng, underscores her resilience and rapid ascent in professional tennis.
Originally from Mason, Ohio, Stearns began playing tennis at the age of eight. She achieved significant success in collegiate tennis, becoming the first player in the University of Texas programâ€™s history to win an NCAA Singles crown in 2022. Transitioning to the professional circuit, Stearns captured her maiden WTA title at the Rabat Grand Prix in 2024 and reached the fourth round of the 2023 US Open, propelling her into the Top 50 rankings. Her aggressive playing style and forehand have marked her as a rising star in the tennis world.
The incident in Dubai highlights the physical demands placed on professional athletes, especially when tournament schedules are disrupted. Stearnsâ€™ experience serves as a reminder of the importance of adequate rest and recovery time to maintain peak performance and health. As she recovers, the tennis community will undoubtedly monitor her progress, anticipating her return to competition and continued ascent in the sport.
Inside the Baselineâ€¦
Tournament scheduling will always be a battle between fairness and practicality, but days like Peyton Stearnsâ€™ in Dubai make it clear where the balance has tipped too far. No player should be pushed to the point of physical collapse just to keep the schedule moving. Itâ€™s easy to praise grit and toughness, but at some point, the demands become unreasonable, turning resilience into survival. The sport prides itself on endurance, yet situations like this expose the fine line between testing an athleteâ€™s limits and outright disregarding them.
Highly donâ€™t recommend having a GI illness & playing 2 matches in a dayâ€¦ not a good combo ğŸ¥² pic.twitter.com/pKKwQc9o9c
â€” Peyton Stearns (@peyton_stearns) February 20, 2025

author: AFP
title: UNESCO awards press prize to Palestinian journalists in Gaza - Digital Journal
text:
Journalists film from atop a damaged building facing the ravaged Al-Salam hospital in Khan Yunis in Gaza in April 2024 - Copyright AFP/File - UNESCO on Thursday awarded its world press freedom prize to all Palestinian journalists covering the war in Gaza, where Israel has been battling Hamas for more than six months.
â€œIn these times of darkness and hopelessness, we wish to share a strong message of solidarity and recognition to those Palestinian journalists who are covering this crisis in such dramatic circumstances,â€ said Mauricio Weibel, chair of the international jury of media professionals.
â€œAs humanity, we have a huge debt to their courage and commitment to freedom of expression.â€
Audrey Azoulay, director general at the UN organisation for education, science and culture, said the prize paid â€œtribute to the courage of journalists facing difficult and dangerous circumstancesâ€.
According to the New York-based Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ), at least 97 members of the press have been killed since the war broke out in October, 92 of whom were Palestinians.
The war started with Hamasâ€™s unprecedented October 7 attack on Israel that resulted in the deaths of 1,170 people, mostly civilians, according to an AFP tally of Israeli official figures.
Israel estimates that 129 captives seized by militants during their attack remain in Gaza. The military says 34 of them are dead.
Israelâ€™s retaliatory offensive against Hamas has killed at least 34,596 people in Gaza, mostly women and children, according to the Hamas-run territoryâ€™s health ministry.

author: VNExplorer
title: Luis DÃ­az y Liverpool celebran liderato tras resultado del Arsenal
text:
Arsenal pierde, celebra Luis DÃ­az.
Los Reds cierran el 2023 al frente de la tabla en la Premier League.
Relevo en el liderato de la Premier League: el Arsenal se vio sorprendido en su estadio al caer 2-0 ante su vecino West Ham, este jueves en el partido que cerrÃ³ la 19Âª jornada, donde no pudo retener el liderato.
El checo Tomas Soucek (minuto 13) y el griego Konstantinos Mavropanos (55) firmaron esta victoria del West Ham bajo la lluvia en el Emirates Stadium.
Los â€˜Gunnersâ€™ se quedan con 40 puntos, a dos del Liverpool (42), que en el â€˜Boxing Dayâ€™ del martes habÃ­a ganado 2-0 en el terreno del modesto Burnley (19Âº) y se habÃ­a colocado en cabeza provisionalmente, con apariciÃ³n del colombiano Luis DÃ­az.
La derrota del Arsenal ante los â€˜Hammersâ€™ hace que el liderato de los pupilos de JÃ¼rgen Klopp sea ya en firme, al menos hasta la siguiente jornada, que arranca el sÃ¡bado.
Arsenal vs. West Ham. EFE
Precisamente, el Arsenal habÃ­a mantenido el liderato el pasado domingo con un empate 1-1 en el campo del Liverpool. Esta vez tuvo que claudicar en su objetivo ante un West Ham (6Âº) en puestos europeos.
Respecto a otros perseguidores, el Arsenal sigue un punto por delante del Aston Villa (3Âº), que perdiÃ³ el martes 3-2 en el campo del Manchester United, pero ve acercarse a tres puntos al Manchester City (4Âº), que el miÃ©rcoles ganÃ³ 3-1 en el campo del Everton (17Âº) y que tiene ademÃ¡s un partido disputado menos que el resto de formaciones de la parte alta de la clasificaciÃ³n.
El Tottenham (5Âº), que fue derrotado 4-2 en el campo del Brighton (8Âº) este jueves, es otro de los perdedores de esta jornada al salir de la â€˜zona Championsâ€™ y quedar ahora a seis puntos del lÃ­der Liverpool.
AFP

author: CNN Newssource
title: â€˜Someone actually caresâ€™: Man gives firsthand account of living unhoused in blistering cold
text:
â€˜Someone actually caresâ€™: Man gives firsthand account of living unhoused in blistering cold
By Grant Stephens
Click here for updates on this story
KANSAS CITY, Missouri (
KSHB) â€” Itâ€™s still awfully cold, and that means the need to help people living outside or on the streets is still just as great.
A group of KC-metro area volunteers hit the cold streets to help Monday night.
Steven, a man who has spent the last few years homeless, said this cold spell has been the worst heâ€™s felt in years.
â€œOh itâ€™s terrible,â€ Steve said. â€œIt hurts. You try to go to sleep and you wake up with your feet hurting and your hands hurting and your knees and everythingâ€™s so cold and nobody cares. The other night I was in the middle of 12th street just screaming, â€˜Somebody help me! Iâ€™m freezing!â€™ I need a ride you know? And nobody stopped. Nobody stopped.â€
There are hundreds of unhoused people like Steven in dozens of camps across KCMO.
â€œEverybody has a story,â€ said Shelle West, the founder of Show Me You Care KC. â€œAnd everybodyâ€™s not homeless or houseless by choice. Sometimes, itâ€™s the last option. Sometimes, this is all they have.â€
For whatever reason, theyâ€™re outside in the cold, a place many believe is their only option.
â€œYou canâ€™t even hardly imagine,â€ Nikki Klein, one of the volunteers said. â€œIâ€™m constantly in my mind thinking, â€˜How do people live like this? How do you literally live outside when itâ€™s below zero.â€
Klein and other volunteers brought blankets, food, and hand warmers.
They do their best to convince people to get treatment for some of their cold-related injuries.
Frostbite is common.
â€œThe pain in your feet mostly and your hands. Yeah, itâ€™s bad,â€ Steven said.
Coats, socks, fuel â€“ physical things go a long way â€“ but a warm heart takes it further.
â€œWe want to show them that we care,â€ West said. â€œAnd that there are people out here that truly care, that wonâ€™t ride past them.â€
It makes all the difference to Steven.
â€œItâ€™s just the love that they show you more than anything, that someone actually cares,â€ Steven said.
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.
